title: One Child's Outsized Influence On The Debate Over Plastic Straws
body: Milo Cress says straws are among the most common disposable plastic items, along with bottle caps, that can be found polluting oceans and beaches. Milos Bicanski/Getty Images hide caption
readable_content: - Hi! This is an article from NPR about a young environmentalist, Milo Cress, who played a significant role in the debate over plastic straws and their impact on the environment. The article discusses how Cress, at the age of nine, estimated that Americans use 500 million straws each day by contacting straw manufacturers directly. This estimate has been widely cited and sparked conversations about reducing straw usage. Cress emphasizes the need to focus on reducing straw usage rather than the exact number. He also talks about his personal efforts to limit the use of disposable plastics and his hopes to study the application of computer technology to the environmental field. It's a great read about the impact one individual can have on an important environmental issue.
summary:
The article highlights the proactive and influential actions of Milo Cress in raising awareness about the environmental impact of plastic straws. It underscores the importance of addressing the issue of plastic straw usage and emphasizes the potential for meaningful change through individual efforts. Overall, the sentiment is positive and hopeful.
